missing_domains.description: Manages the entire lifecycle of partners, from onboarding and verification to activation, role assignment, and offboarding.
missing_domains.reasoning: Vendors emphasise that partner onboarding is a critical capability – Comarch’s partner management system includes partner onboarding and automates the process from quoting to ordering [oai_citation:0‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=Comarch%20Partner%20Management%20system%20provides,features%20from%20partner%20onboarding%20to), and the TMF668 API identifies partnership types and role types needed during onboarding [oai_citation:1‡tmforum.org](https://www.tmforum.org/oda/open-apis/directory/partnership-management-api-TMF668/v4.0#:~:text=Standardized%20mechanisms%20for%20creating%20partnership,resources).

missing_domains.description: Tracks partner activity, sales pipeline, performance metrics, and provides communication and training tools to engage partners.
missing_domains.reasoning: Salesforce’s PRM emphasises real‑time tracking and pipeline inspection to help partners focus on the right leads [oai_citation:2‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=Get%20data%20and%20AI,relationship%20management%20software) and recommends onboarding and training tools [oai_citation:3‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/what-is-prm/#:~:text=,follow%2C%20and%20easy%20to%20update). ServiceNow’s TSM connects customers and partners across the value chain for seamless service resolution [oai_citation:4‡servicenow.com](https://www.servicenow.com/standard/resource-center/data-sheet/ds-servicenow-telecommunications-service-management.html#:~:text=guides%20for%20common%20tasks,products%20and%20services%2C%20notify%20customers), underscoring the need for partner engagement.

missing_domains.description: Supports creation, negotiation, approval, and renewal of partner contracts and agreement templates, including digital signatures and compliance tracking.
missing_domains.reasoning: The TMF668 partnership management API associates partnership types with role‑specific agreement specifications [oai_citation:5‡tmforum.org](https://www.tmforum.org/oda/open-apis/directory/partnership-management-api-TMF668/v4.0#:~:text=Standardized%20mechanisms%20for%20creating%20partnership,resources), and telecom partnerships often involve complex contracts that must be managed and renewed.

missing_domains.description: Provides catalog‑driven quote generation, pricing configuration, order capture, and conversion of accepted quotes into orders.
missing_domains.reasoning: Comarch’s partner management system offers a catalog‑driven approach to quoting and converts accepted bids into customer orders [oai_citation:6‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=Comarch%20Partner%20Management%20system%20provides,features%20from%20partner%20onboarding%20to), highlighting quoting and ordering as core partner management capabilities.

missing_domains.description: Handles commission calculation, revenue sharing, invoicing, multi‑currency support, tax rules, and partner settlements.
missing_domains.reasoning: Comarch emphasises multi‑currency support and multi‑side settlements, providing a single platform to settle with partners and issue invoices [oai_citation:7‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=Multi,deploy%20global) [oai_citation:8‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=New%20pricing%20models%2C%20multi). Effective partner management must support these settlement processes.

missing_domains.description: Provides marketing fund management, co‑branded campaigns, training materials, and self‑service resources to enable partners to generate demand.
missing_domains.reasoning: Salesforce’s partner marketing automation allows pre‑built marketing journeys and co‑branded assets while automating marketing fund and campaign requests [oai_citation:9‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=Partner%20Marketing%20Automation). missing_domains.description: Delivers dashboards and reports with real‑time partner performance metrics, predictive insights, and KPI tracking.
missing_domains.reasoning: Salesforce’s PRM provides out‑of‑the‑box dashboards and AI‑generated insights about revenue potential [oai_citation:11‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=Partner%20Analytics%20and%20Insights), while partners need analytics to assess performance and forecast results.

missing_domains.description: Offers self‑service portals, knowledge bases, AI‑powered chatbots, ticketing, and escalation workflows for partner support.
missing_domains.reasoning: Salesforce PRM offers AI‑powered partner self‑service to give partners quick access to knowledge articles and bots [oai_citation:12‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=AI). missing_domains.description: Provides standardized APIs and integration mechanisms to synchronize data with external systems, CRMs, and partner platforms while ensuring security and privacy.
missing_domains.reasoning: The TMF668 API standardizes partnership management for onboarding and role types [oai_citation:14‡tmforum.org](https://www.tmforum.org/oda/open-apis/directory/partnership-management-api-TMF668/v4.0#:~:text=Standardized%20mechanisms%20for%20creating%20partnership,resources), and Salesforce’s Partner Connect enables partners to work across CRMs with real‑time updates and field synchronization [oai_citation:15‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=Partner%20Selling%20Across%20CRMs). missing_domains.description: Ensures partner KYC/due‑diligence, regulatory compliance, risk scoring, and audit tracking across the partner ecosystem.
missing_domains.reasoning: Telecom partnerships require compliance with regulations and contract terms. While vendors do not explicitly highlight this, the domain is necessary to manage risk and ensure adherence to agreements and regulatory requirements.

missing_attributes.description: Capture partner information, verify credentials (KYC), perform due diligence, and approve partner registration.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Comarch’s partner management highlights partner onboarding as a critical step [oai_citation:17‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=Comarch%20Partner%20Management%20system%20provides,features%20from%20partner%20onboarding%20to), and the TMF668 API identifies partnership types and role types that must be established during onboarding [oai_citation:18‡tmforum.org](https://www.tmforum.org/oda/open-apis/directory/partnership-management-api-TMF668/v4.0#:~:text=Standardized%20mechanisms%20for%20creating%20partnership,resources).

missing_attributes.description: Define partner roles (e.g., buyer, seller, developer), assign permissions, and manage access to systems and resources.

missing_attributes.description: Manage partner termination, including revoking access, settling accounts, and archiving data.

missing_attributes.description: Measure partner sales performance, pipeline progress, customer satisfaction, and compliance metrics.

missing_attributes.description: Provide training modules, certification programs, and track completion and proficiency for partner users.

missing_attributes.description: Enable notifications, messaging, forums, and shared workspaces to facilitate collaboration between CSP staff and partners.
missing_attributes.reasoning: ServiceNow TSM connects customers and partners across the value chain for seamless service and issue resolution [oai_citation:22‡servicenow.com](https://www.servicenow.com/standard/resource-center/data-sheet/ds-servicenow-telecommunications-service-management.html#:~:text=guides%20for%20common%20tasks,products%20and%20services%2C%20notify%20customers), indicating the need for collaboration tools.

missing_attributes.description: Maintain standardized contract templates and define partner‑specific terms, including service levels, payment terms, and roles.

Having templates ensures consistent agreements and faster negotiations.

missing_attributes.description: Track negotiation activities, versioning, approvals and sign‑offs for partner agreements.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Telecom contracts often involve multiple parties and require formal approvals; a workflow ensures transparency and compliance.

missing_attributes.description: Monitor agreement expirations, trigger renewal processes, and ensure partners adhere to contractual obligations and regulatory requirements.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Agreements must be renewed periodically; tracking renewals and compliance helps avoid lapses and ensures partners meet obligations.

missing_attributes.description: Allow partners to generate quotes based on catalogue items, pricing rules, discounts, and multi‑currency options.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Comarch’s system supports quick, catalog‑driven quotations that are automated and accurate [oai_citation:24‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=Comarch%20Partner%20Management%20system%20provides,features%20from%20partner%20onboarding%20to), demonstrating the importance of quote generation capabilities.

missing_attributes.description: Capture orders from accepted quotes, track order status, coordinate fulfillment, and handle partial orders.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Comarch notes that accepted bids are converted into customer orders [oai_citation:25‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=first%20quotation%20is%20carried%20out,converted%20into%20a%20customer%20order); managing orders is a core partner management function.

missing_attributes.description: Manage partner‑specific pricing, discounts, and promotions to support various business models.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Telecom partners may require custom pricing and discount schemes; Comarch’s support for various business models [oai_citation:26‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=Comarch%20Partner%20Management%20system%20provides,features%20from%20partner%20onboarding%20to) implies the need for flexible pricing.

missing_attributes.description: Calculate partner commissions, revenue shares, and settlements based on sales performance and agreement terms.

missing_attributes.description: Generate invoices, process payments, handle tax rules and ensure timely settlement with partners.
missing_attributes.reasoning: The Comarch system emphasises issuing invoices to end customers and settling with partners [oai_citation:28‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=New%20pricing%20models%2C%20multi), requiring robust invoicing and payment processing.

missing_attributes.description: Support transactions in multiple currencies and automatically apply relevant tax rules based on jurisdiction.

missing_attributes.description: Use AI/ML to predict partner performance, revenue trends and customer churn to inform strategy.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Predictive insights help CSPs and partners plan resources and optimise engagement; Salesforce emphasises AI‑generated insights [oai_citation:36‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=Partner%20Analytics%20and%20Insights).

missing_attributes.description: Generate reports on commissions, settlements, contract compliance and operational KPIs for internal and regulatory stakeholders.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Reporting on financials and compliance supports transparency and helps meet audit requirements.

missing_attributes.description: Provide partners with a portal to log issues, track tickets, interact with support teams and monitor resolution status.

missing_attributes.description: Define and monitor service level agreements for partner support, automatically escalating unresolved issues.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Managing service performance and escalations ensures partners receive timely support and maintains quality of service.

missing_attributes.description: Support TM Forum APIs (e.g., TMF668) and other standard interfaces to integrate partner data and processes.
missing_attributes.reasoning: TMF668 standardises partnership management and defines APIs for creating and updating partnership types [oai_citation:39‡tmforum.org](https://www.tmforum.org/oda/open-apis/directory/partnership-management-api-TMF668/v4.0#:~:text=Standardized%20mechanisms%20for%20creating%20partnership,resources); integrating with TM Forum APIs (e.g., TMF620 Product Catalog, TMF621 Trouble Ticket) is recommended [oai_citation:40‡servicenow.com](https://www.servicenow.com/standard/resource-center/data-sheet/ds-servicenow-telecommunications-service-management.html#:~:text=standard%20integrations%20Telecommunications%20Service%20Management,Learn%20more%20about%20ServiceNow).

missing_attributes.description: Enable partners to work from their own systems while synchronising data across CRM, billing, and OSS/BSS platforms.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Salesforce’s Partner Connect allows partners to securely work and track deals from any CRM with real‑time updates and field synchronization [oai_citation:41‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=Partner%20Selling%20Across%20CRMs), highlighting the importance of cross‑system integration.

missing_attributes.description: Ensure secure access to partner data, apply encryption, and enforce privacy rules across integrations.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Integrating multiple systems requires robust data security; partners and customers expect their data to be protected and compliant with regulations.

missing_attributes.description: Perform know‑your‑customer/know‑your‑partner checks, assess financial and legal risk, and record verification results.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Telecom partnerships involve financial transactions; performing due diligence reduces risk and aligns with regulatory requirements.

missing_attributes.description: Monitor partner adherence to telecom regulations, data privacy laws, and contract terms.
missing_attributes.reasoning: CSPs operate in heavily regulated environments; tracking compliance ensures that partners meet legal obligations and reduces liability.

missing_attributes.description: Generate audit trails, risk scores and compliance reports for internal governance and external regulators.
missing_attributes.reasoning: Audit trails support transparency and help identify potential risks; while important, it may be prioritised after core operational attributes are in place.

market_research.competitive_analysis: Comarch’s Partner Management system models various types of partnerships and supports partner onboarding, quoting, ordering, and settlements with catalog‑driven processes and multi‑currency/multi‑tenancy support [oai_citation:42‡comarch.com](https://www.comarch.com/telecommunications/bss-solutions/partner-management/#:~:text=Modern%20telecom%20systems%20fit%20for,enrich%20the%20CSP%27s%20service%20portfolio). ServiceNow’s Telecommunications Service Management unifies service and network operations, provides AI‑powered self‑service and agent assistance, and rapidly onboards customers and partners while connecting the entire value chain for seamless issue resolution [oai_citation:43‡servicenow.com](https://www.servicenow.com/standard/resource-center/data-sheet/ds-servicenow-telecommunications-service-management.html). Salesforce’s Partner Relationship Management offers sales tracking, partner selling across CRMs, partner analytics and insights, marketing automation, AI‑powered partner self‑service, and centralized channel management [oai_citation:44‡salesforce.com](https://www.salesforce.com/sales/partner-relationship-management/#:~:text=Get%20data%20and%20AI,relationship%20management%20software).

recommendations.next_steps: Define and implement the recommended domains and attributes to build a comprehensive Partner Management capability. Prioritise high‑importance domains such as partner lifecycle, quoting and ordering, settlements, and contract management, and ensure alignment with TM Forum standards like TMF668. Assess existing systems and integrate vendor solutions (e.g., Comarch, ServiceNow or Salesforce) to expedite capability delivery. Establish governance processes for compliance and data integration, and develop analytics and marketing modules as subsequent phases.
